AUTONOMIC NEUROPATHY

CAUSES
autonomic failure may be secondary to
peripheral neuropathy associated with diabetes,
cancer (paraneoplastic), amyloidosis, cachexia,
HIV, Guillain Barre syndrome, Lambert Eaton syn
drome, other inflammatory/infectious conditions,
or due to primary disorders such as Parkinson’s
disease, Shy Drager syndrome (multiple system
atrophy with autonomic failure), Lewy body
dementia, and multiple sclerosis
